verses.text: And it came to pass \w after|strong="H0310"\w* this, that \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w* had a \w fair|strong="H3303"\w* \w sister|strong="H0269"\w*, whose \w name|strong="H8034"\w* \add was\add* \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w*; and \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w loved|strong="H0157"\w* her.

And \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* was so \w vexed|strong="H3334"\w*, that he fell \w sick|strong="H2470"\w* for his \w sister|strong="H0269"\w* \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w*; for she \add was\add* a \w virgin|strong="H1330"\w*; and \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* \w thought|strong="H5869"\w* it \w hard|strong="H6381"\w* for him to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* any \w thing|strong="H3972"\w* to her.\f + \fr 13.2 \ft Amnon thought…: Heb. it was marvellous, or, hidden in the eyes of Amnon\f*

But \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* had a \w friend|strong="H7453"\w*, whose \w name|strong="H8034"\w* \add was\add* \w Jonadab|strong="H3122"\w*, the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Shimeah|strong="H8093"\w* \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*: and \w Jonadab|strong="H3122"\w* \add was\add* a \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w subtil|strong="H2450"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w*.

And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, Why \add art\add* thou, \add being\add* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, \w lean|strong="H1800"\w* from \w day|strong="H1242"\w* to \w day|strong="H1242"\w*? wilt thou not \w tell|strong="H5046"\w* me? And \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, I \w love|strong="H0157"\w* \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w*, my \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \w Absalom’s|strong="H0053"\w* \w sister|strong="H0269"\w*.\f + \fr 13.4 \ft lean: Heb. thin\f*\f + \fr 13.4 \ft from day…: Heb. morning by morning\f*

And \w Jonadab|strong="H3082"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, Lay thee \w down|strong="H7901"\w* on thy \w bed|strong="H4904"\w*, and make thyself \w sick|strong="H2470"\w*: and when thy \w father|strong="H0001"\w* \w cometh|strong="H0935"\w* to \w see|strong="H7200"\w* thee, \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, I pray thee, let my \w sister|strong="H0269"\w* \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w*, and \w give|strong="H1262"\w* me \w meat|strong="H3899"\w*, and \w dress|strong="H6213"\w* the \w meat|strong="H1279"\w* in my \w sight|strong="H5869"\w*, that I may \w see|strong="H7200"\w* \add it\add*, and \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* \add it\add* at her \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*.

¶ So \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* lay \w down|strong="H7901"\w*, and made himself \w sick|strong="H2470"\w*: and when the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* was \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to \w see|strong="H7200"\w* him, \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, I pray thee, let \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w* my \w sister|strong="H0269"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w*, and \w make|strong="H3823"\w* me a \w couple|strong="H8147"\w* of \w cakes|strong="H3834"\w* in my \w sight|strong="H5869"\w*, that I may \w eat|strong="H1262"\w* at her \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*.

Then \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w home|strong="H1004"\w* to \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Go|strong="H3212"\w* now to thy \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \w Amnon’s|strong="H0550"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and \w dress|strong="H6213"\w* him \w meat|strong="H1279"\w*.

So \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w* \w went|strong="H3212"\w* to her \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \w Amnon’s|strong="H0550"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*; and he was laid \w down|strong="H7901"\w*. And she \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w flour|strong="H1217"\w*, and \w kneaded|strong="H3888"\w* \add it\add*, and made \w cakes|strong="H3823"\w* in his \w sight|strong="H5869"\w*, and did \w bake|strong="H1310"\w* the \w cakes|strong="H3834"\w*.\f + \fr 13.8 \ft flour: or, paste\f*

And she \w took|strong="H3947"\w* a \w pan|strong="H4958"\w*, and poured \add them\add* \w out|strong="H3332"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him; but he \w refused|strong="H3985"\w* to \w eat|strong="H0398"\w*. And \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Have \w out|strong="H3318"\w* all \w men|strong="H0376"\w* from me. And they went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* every \w man|strong="H0376"\w* from him.

And \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w*, \w Bring|strong="H0935"\w* the \w meat|strong="H1279"\w* into the \w chamber|strong="H2315"\w*, that I may \w eat|strong="H1262"\w* of thine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*. And \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* the \w cakes|strong="H3834"\w* which she had \w made|strong="H6213"\w*, and \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* \add them\add* into the \w chamber|strong="H2315"\w* to \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* her \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*.

And when she had \w brought|strong="H5066"\w* \add them\add* unto him to \w eat|strong="H0398"\w*, he took \w hold|strong="H2388"\w* of her, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto her, \w Come|strong="H0935"\w* \w lie|strong="H7901"\w* with me, my \w sister|strong="H0269"\w*.

And she \w answered|strong="H0559"\w* him, Nay, my \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*, do not \w force|strong="H6031"\w* me; for no such thing \w ought|strong="H3651"\w* to be \w done|strong="H6213"\w* in \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*: \w do|strong="H6213"\w* not thou this \w folly|strong="H5039"\w*.\f + \fr 13.12 \ft force…: Heb. humble me\f*\f + \fr 13.12 \ft no such…: Heb. it ought not so to be done\f*

And I, whither shall I cause my \w shame|strong="H2781"\w* to \w go|strong="H3212"\w*? and as for thee, thou shalt be as \w one|strong="H0259"\w* of the \w fools|strong="H5036"\w* in \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*. Now therefore, I pray thee, \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*; for he will not \w withhold|strong="H4513"\w* me from thee.

Howbeit he \w would|strong="H0014"\w* not \w hearken|strong="H8085"\w* unto her \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*: but, being \w stronger|strong="H2388"\w* than she, \w forced|strong="H6031"\w* her, and \w lay|strong="H7901"\w* with her.

¶ Then \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* \w hated|strong="H8130"\w* her \w exceedingly|strong="H3966"\w*; so that the \w hatred|strong="H8135"\w* wherewith he \w hated|strong="H8130"\w* her \add was\add* \w greater|strong="H1419"\w* than the \w love|strong="H0160"\w* wherewith he had \w loved|strong="H0157"\w* her. And \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto her, \w Arise|strong="H6965"\w*, be \w gone|strong="H3212"\w*.\f + \fr 13.15 \ft exceedingly: Heb. with great hatred greatly\f*

And she \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, \add There is\add* no \w cause|strong="H0182"\w*: this \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* in sending me \w away|strong="H7971"\w* \add is\add* \w greater|strong="H1419"\w* than the \w other|strong="H0312"\w* that thou \w didst|strong="H6213"\w* unto me. But he \w would|strong="H0014"\w* not \w hearken|strong="H8085"\w* unto her.

Then he \w called|strong="H7121"\w* his \w servant|strong="H5288"\w* that \w ministered|strong="H8334"\w* unto him, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Put|strong="H7971"\w* now this \add woman\add* \w out|strong="H2351"\w* from me, and \w bolt|strong="H5274"\w* the \w door|strong="H1817"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* her.

And \add she had\add* a \w garment|strong="H3801"\w* of divers \w colours|strong="H6446"\w* upon her: for with such \w robes|strong="H4598"\w* were the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* \add that were\add* \w virgins|strong="H1330"\w* \w apparelled|strong="H3847"\w*. Then his \w servant|strong="H8334"\w* \w brought|strong="H3318"\w* her \w out|strong="H2351"\w*, and \w bolted|strong="H5274"\w* the \w door|strong="H1817"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* her.

¶ And \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w* \w put|strong="H3947"\w* \w ashes|strong="H0665"\w* on her \w head|strong="H7218"\w*, and \w rent|strong="H7167"\w* her \w garment|strong="H3801"\w* of divers \w colours|strong="H6446"\w* that \add was\add* on her, and \w laid|strong="H7760"\w* her \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* on her \w head|strong="H7218"\w*, and \w went|strong="H3212"\w* \w on|strong="H1980"\w* \w crying|strong="H2199"\w*.

And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* her \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto her, Hath \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* thy \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* been with thee? but hold now thy \w peace|strong="H2790"\w*, my \w sister|strong="H0269"\w*: he \add is\add* thy \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*; \w regard|strong="H7896"\w* not this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*. So \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w* \w remained|strong="H3427"\w* \w desolate|strong="H8074"\w* in her \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \w Absalom’s|strong="H0053"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.\f + \fr 13.20 \ft Amnon: Heb. Aminon\f*\f + \fr 13.20 \ft regard…: Heb. set not thy heart\f*\f + \fr 13.20 \ft desolate: Heb. and desolate\f*
¶ But when \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* of all these \w things|strong="H1697"\w*, he was \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w wroth|strong="H2734"\w*.

And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* unto his brother \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* neither \w good|strong="H2896"\w* nor \w bad|strong="H7451"\w*: for \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w hated|strong="H8130"\w* \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w*, \w because|strong="H1697"\w* he had \w forced|strong="H6031"\w* his \w sister|strong="H0269"\w* \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w*.

¶ And it came to pass after two \w full|strong="H3117"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w*, that \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* had \w sheepshearers|strong="H1494"\w* in \w Baal-hazor|strong="H1178"\w*, which \add is\add* beside \w Ephraim|strong="H0669"\w*: and \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w invited|strong="H7121"\w* all the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w*.

And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Behold now, thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* hath \w sheepshearers|strong="H1494"\w*; \w let|strong="H3212"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, I beseech thee, and his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w go|strong="H3212"\w* with thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, Nay, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, let us not all now \w go|strong="H3212"\w*, lest we be \w chargeable|strong="H3513"\w* unto thee. And he \w pressed|strong="H6555"\w* him: howbeit he \w would|strong="H0014"\w* not \w go|strong="H3212"\w*, but \w blessed|strong="H1288"\w* him.

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, If not, I pray thee, let my \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* \w go|strong="H3212"\w* with us. And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, Why should he \w go|strong="H3212"\w* with thee?

But \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w pressed|strong="H6555"\w* him, that he let \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* and all the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w go|strong="H7971"\w* with him.

¶ Now \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* had \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* his \w servants|strong="H5288"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Mark|strong="H7200"\w* ye now when \w Amnon’s|strong="H0550"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* is \w merry|strong="H2896"\w* with \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*, and when I \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto you, \w Smite|strong="H5221"\w* \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w*; then \w kill|strong="H4191"\w* him, \w fear|strong="H3372"\w* not: have not I \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* you? be \w courageous|strong="H2388"\w*, and be \w valiant|strong="H1121"\w*.\f + \fr 13.28 \ft have…: or, will you not, since I have commanded you?\f*\f + \fr 13.28 \ft valiant: Heb. sons of valour\f*

And the \w servants|strong="H5288"\w* of \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w did|strong="H6213"\w* unto \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* as \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* had \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w*. Then all the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w arose|strong="H6965"\w*, and every \w man|strong="H0376"\w* gat him \w up|strong="H7392"\w* upon his \w mule|strong="H6505"\w*, and \w fled|strong="H5127"\w*.\f + \fr 13.29 \ft gat…: Heb. rode\f*

¶ And it came to pass, while they were in the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*, that \w tidings|strong="H8052"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* hath \w slain|strong="H5221"\w* all the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w*, and there is not \w one|strong="H0259"\w* of them \w left|strong="H3498"\w*.

Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w arose|strong="H6965"\w*, and \w tare|strong="H7167"\w* his \w garments|strong="H0899"\w*, and \w lay|strong="H7901"\w* on the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*; and all his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w stood|strong="H5324"\w* by with their \w clothes|strong="H0899"\w* \w rent|strong="H7167"\w*.

And \w Jonadab|strong="H3122"\w*, the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Shimeah|strong="H8093"\w* \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*, \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Let not my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* \w suppose|strong="H0559"\w* \add that\add* they have \w slain|strong="H4191"\w* all the young \w men|strong="H5288"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w*; for \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* only is \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*: for by the \w appointment|strong="H6310"\w* of \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* this hath been \w determined|strong="H7760"\w* from the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* that he \w forced|strong="H6031"\w* his \w sister|strong="H0269"\w* \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w*.\f + \fr 13.32 \ft appointment: Heb. mouth\f*\f + \fr 13.32 \ft determined: or, settled\f*

Now therefore let not my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w take|strong="H7760"\w* the \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* to his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, to \w think|strong="H0559"\w* that all the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* are \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*: for \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w* only is \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*.

But \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w fled|strong="H1272"\w*. And the young \w man|strong="H5288"\w* that kept the \w watch|strong="H6822"\w* lifted \w up|strong="H5375"\w* his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*, and \w looked|strong="H7200"\w*, and, behold, there \w came|strong="H1980"\w* \w much|strong="H7227"\w* \w people|strong="H5971"\w* by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* of the \w hill|strong="H2022"\w* \w side|strong="H6654"\w* \w behind|strong="H0310"\w* him.

And \w Jonadab|strong="H3122"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, Behold, the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w*: as thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w said|strong="H1697"\w*, so it is.\f + \fr 13.35 \ft as thy…: Heb. according to the word of thy servant\f*

And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an \w end|strong="H3615"\w* of \w speaking|strong="H1696"\w*, that, behold, the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w*, and lifted \w up|strong="H5375"\w* their \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* and \w wept|strong="H1058"\w*: and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* also and all his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w wept|strong="H1058"\w* \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w sore|strong="H1065"\w*.\f + \fr 13.36 \ft very…: Heb. with a great weeping greatly\f*

¶ But \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w fled|strong="H1272"\w*, and \w went|strong="H3212"\w* to \w Talmai|strong="H8526"\w*, the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammihud|strong="H5991"\w*, \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Geshur|strong="H1650"\w*. And \add David\add* \w mourned|strong="H0056"\w* for his \w son|strong="H1121"\w* every \w day|strong="H3117"\w*.\f + \fr 13.37 \ft Ammihud: or, Ammihur\f*
So \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w fled|strong="H1272"\w*, and \w went|strong="H3212"\w* to \w Geshur|strong="H1650"\w*, and was there \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w*.

And \add the soul of\add* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w longed|strong="H3615"\w* to go \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* unto \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*: for he was \w comforted|strong="H5162"\w* concerning \w Amnon|strong="H0550"\w*, seeing he was \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*.\f + \fr 13.39 \ft longed: or, was consumed\f*
